greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative order of 16 mod 2n+1.
comment: a(n) <= n; it appears that equality holds if and only if n=1 or is in A163778. - _Robert Israel_, Apr 02 2018
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 1001 terms from Jianing Song)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Multiplicative Order
example: The fraction 1/13 is equal to 0.13B13B... in hexadecimal, so a(6) = 3.
program: (MAGMA) [1] cat [ Modorder(16, 2*n+1): n in [1..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 03 2018
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Apr 02 2018
